newsitem.title: USA: Republic says ADT deal going forward.
newsitem.headline: Republic says ADT deal going forward.

text.p: Republic Industries Inc said on Friday its merger with ADT Ltd was moving forward despite a newspaper report that the transaction would be called off.
"The deal has not been killed. It is still moving forward," Republic spokesman Ronald Castell told Reuters.
The New York Post reported on Friday that ADT planned to call off the merger.
ADT could not be reached for comment, but Wall Street analysts told Reuters that the company had indicated that this was not the case.
"What ADT has told me is that nothing has changed," said Andrew Jeffrey of Robertson Stephens & Co.
Shares of Republic rose as high as 26-1/8 in morning trade but had retreated to 25 by midday, up 1/2 from Thursday's close.
Republic's share price has declined in recent weeks, raising speculation that terms of the proposed stock deal might have to be revised.
Castell declined to discuss the valuation of the transaction.
